intro: Craspedaria surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam craspeda, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Suriname and Guyana. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves with a velvety texture. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters. Craspedaria surinamensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
